batch_meta.notes: Step1-like pilot batch; validation_profile=dryrun; choice-level explanations required.
batch_meta.step1_stems_notes: Template-based Step1-like stems generated from PMC XML anchors; no verbatim copying.

question.stem:
A 22-year-old man presents with symptoms that have progressed over 3 months. The patient has history of poorly controlled diabetes mellitus. Physical examination shows scattered crackles on lung auscultation and mild tachycardia. Vital signs: Temp 38.3°C (101°F), BP 112/70 mmHg, HR 104/min, RR 18/min. Laboratory studies show leukocytosis and elevated C-reactive protein. Recent literature on mitral, surgical, right has highlighted clinically important patterns that can be tested at the bedside. Which of the following pathways is most directly involved?

Additional history reveals intermittent constitutional symptoms and a partial response to symptomatic therapy. A targeted diagnostic workup is performed to distinguish between competing etiologies based on physiology, pathology, and pharmacology principles.

educational_blocks.educational_objective: Connect a clinical presentation to the underlying mitral mechanism and distinguish key alternatives.
educational_blocks.bottom_line: Use core pathophysiology to map symptoms and labs to a single best explanation; avoid distractors that do not fit the mechanism.
educational_blocks.exam_tip: On Step 1, look for one or two discriminating clues (timing, labs, classic association) that align with mitral.

meta.title: Empagliflozin-associated postoperative mixed metabolic acidosis. Case report and review of pathogenesis.

question.stem:
A 22-year-old woman presents with symptoms that have progressed over 2 weeks. The patient has no significant past medical history. Physical examination shows scattered crackles on lung auscultation and mild tachycardia. Vital signs: Temp 38.3°C (101°F), BP 112/70 mmHg, HR 104/min, RR 18/min. Laboratory studies show normocytic anemia and elevated LDH. Recent literature on acidosis, renal, hyperchloremic has highlighted clinically important patterns that can be tested at the bedside. meta.title: Sodium chloride : Metabolic acidosis: case report

A 19-year-old man presents with symptoms that have progressed over 6 months. The patient has history of autoimmune thyroid disease. Physical examination shows proximal muscle weakness and hyperpigmented skin lesions. Vital signs: Temp 38.3°C (101°F), BP 112/70 mmHg, HR 104/min, RR 18/min. Laboratory studies show elevated AST/ALT and conjugated hyperbilirubinemia. meta.title: Euglycemic Ketoacidosis Induced by Dapagliflozin in a Non-Diabetic Patient With Cardiac Amyloidosis.

Physical examination shows jaundice and right upper quadrant tenderness. Vital signs: Temp 38.3°C (101°F), BP 112/70 mmHg, HR 104/min, RR 18/min. Laboratory studies show elevated creatinine and proteinuria. Recent literature on metabolic, acidosis, amyloidosis has highlighted clinically important patterns that can be tested at the bedside.
